sen.j: 五条駅（ごじょうえき）は、京都府京都市東山区宮川筋8丁目にある、京阪電気鉄道京阪本線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located at 8-chome Miyagawasuji, Kyoto City of Kyoto Prefecture, Gojo Station is a stop on the Keihan Main Line, a Keihan Electric Railway Line.
Located at 8-chome Miyagawasuji, Kyoto City, in Kyoto Prefecture, Gojo Station is a stop on the Keihan Main Line, a Keihan Electric Railway Line.
Located at 8-chome Miyagawa-suji, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, in Kyoto Prefecture, Gojo Station is a stop on the Keihan Main Line of the Keihan Electric Railway.

sen.j: 急行以下の種別が停車する。
sen.e: Express trains and other trains of slower category stop at this station.
Express trains and other trains of slower categories stop at this station.
Express trains and other trains of slower categories stop at this station.

sen.j: 駅ホームのカラーリングは緑。
sen.e: The color tone of this station is green.
The color tone of this station is green.
The color tone of this station is green.

sen.j: これは抵抗器の抵抗値を表すカラーコードで「5」を意味する。
sen.e: This is the color code depicting the resistance value of resistance units and denotes the numeral 「5.」
sen.cmt: カラーコードは普遍的なものでないと思われます。
sen.e: This is the color code depicting the resistance value of resistance units, and it denotes the numeral "5."
This is the color code depicting the resistance value of resistance units, and it denotes the numeral '5.'

sen.j: 2008年10月19日の京阪中之島線の開業と同時に清水五条駅（きよみずごじょうえき）に改称の予定。
sen.e: Simultaneously with inauguration of the Keihan Nakanoshima Line on Oct.19, 2008, this station is scheduled to be renamed Kiyomizu-Gojo Station.
This station was scheduled to be renamed Kiyomizu-Gojo Station, simultaneously with the inauguration of the Keihan Nakanoshima Line on October 19, 2008.
This station was scheduled to be renamed Kiyomizu-Gojo Station, simultaneously with the inauguration of the Keihan Nakanoshima Line on October 19, 2008.

sen.j: 島式1面2線のホームを持つ地下駅である。
sen.e: It is an underground station with a single so-called "Island" platform between two tracks.
It's an underground station with a single so-called "island" platform between two tracks.
It's an underground station with one so-called island platform between two tracks.

sen.j: 五条大橋東詰、川端通と五条通の交差点の直下に位置する。
sen.e: It is located at Gojo-Ohashi Higashitsume, directly under the intersection of Kawabata-dori Street and Gojo-dori Street.
It is located at Gojo-Ohashi Higashitsume, directly under the intersection of Kawabata-dori and Gojo-dori streets.
It is located at Gojo Ohashi Higashitsume, directly under the intersection of Kawabata-dori and Gojo-dori streets.

sen.j: 地下1階が改札及びコンコース、地下2階がホームとなっている。
sen.e: Tickets gates and concourse are at first underground level and platforms at second underground level.
The tickets gates and concourse are on the first underground level, while the platforms are one the second underground level.
The tickets gates and concourse are on the first underground level, while the platforms are on the second underground level.

sen.j: 改札口は1ヶ所のみで、コンコースとホームの間にはエレベーターと上下2基のエスカレーターが設置されているが、コンコースと地上の間には登りエスカレーターしかない。
sen.e: Ticket gates are installed only at one place, an elevator, ascending and descending escalators installed between concourse and platform levels, but only an ascending escalator is available between the concourse and the ground above.

Ticket gates are installed in only one location; an elevator, and ascending/descending escalators are installed between the concourse and platform levels, but there is just one ascending escalator available between the concourse and the ground above.

Ticket gates are installed in only one location; an elevator, and ascending/descending escalators are installed between the concourse and platform levels, but there is just one ascending escalator available between the concourse and the ground above.

sen.j: ※両ホームとも有効長は8両。
sen.e: ※Both platforms have an effective length to accommodate eight cars.
※Each of the platforms has a length sufficient to accommodate eight cars.
※Each of the platforms has a length sufficient to accommodate eight cars.

sen.j: 自動放送における編成長案内は2番線のみ挿入される。
sen.e: Automated announcment of the number of cars composing trains made only at Track #2 platform..
An automated announcement of the number of cars comprising trains is made only at the Track No. 2 platform.
An automated announcement of the number of cars comprising trains is made only at Platform 2.

Higashiyama Ward Office, Higashiyama Health Center, Higashiyama Ward Social Welfare Office, Higashiyama Ward Library

sen.e: Gojo-dori Street (National Highway Route No.1)
Gojo-dori Street (National Highway Route No. 1)

sen.e: Gojo Keihan-mae

sen.j: 五条大橋東詰（五条通と川端通との交差点）の五条通沿いにある。
sen.e: Located at Gojo Ohashi Higashitsume (Gojo-dori Street and Kawabata-dori Street insection) along Gojo-dori Street.
Located at Gojo Ohashi Higashitsume (Gojo-dori Street and Kawabata-dori Street insection) along Gojo-dori Street.
Located at Gojo Ohashi Higashitsume (Gojo-dori Street and Kawabata-dori Street intersection) along Gojo-dori Street

sen.j: 京都市営バス
sen.e: Kyoto City Bus
Kyoto City Bus

sen.e: Route 80: For Kawaramachi Station (Kyoto Prefecture) (via Gojozaka and Gion)
Route 80, for Kawaramachi Station (Kyoto Prefecture) (via Gojozaka and Gion)
Route 80, for Kawaramachi Station (Kyoto Prefecture) (via Gojozaka and Gion)

sen.e: For Oya, Daigo and Keihan Rokujizo
For Oya, Daigo and Keihan Rokujizo

sen.e: Express bus for Yokkaichi ※(Keihan Bus, Mie Kotsu)
Express bus for Yokkaichi ※(Keihan Bus, Mie Kotsu)
Express bus for Yokkaichi ※(Keihan Bus, Mie Kotsu)

sen.j: 高速バス津駅前ゆき※(近鉄バス、三重交通)
sen.e: Express bus for Tsu-eki-mae※(Kintetsu Bus, Mie Kotsu)
Express bus for Tsu-eki-mae※(Kintetsu Bus, Mie Kotsu)
Express bus for Tsu-eki-mae※(Kintetsu Bus, Mie Kotsu)

sen.j: （※印は2008年3月20日から運転を開始した。）
sen.e: (※Indicates operations commenced March 20, 2008)
(※Indicates operations that commenced March 20, 2008.)
(※Indicates operations that commenced March 20, 2008.)

sen.j: 開業当時の起点駅で、五条通りの南側に駅舎が有った。
sen.e: Starting point station when operations commenced and the then station building stood on the southern side of Gojo-dori Street.
This was the starting-point station when operations commenced; at that time, the station building stood on the southern side of Gojo-dori Street.
This was the starting-point station when operations commenced; at that time, the station building stood on the southern side of Gojo-dori Street.

sen.j: 三条駅延長後も1916年以降急行停車駅であったが太平洋戦争中に急行通過へ変更となり、七条駅～三条駅間で唯一特急・急行が通過する時代が長く続いた。
sen.e: Sanjo Station even after its extension continued to be a station at which express trains stopped after 1916, but such an arrangement changed during WWII and an era during which Gojo Station was the only stop between Shichijo Station and Sanjo Station at which neither super express nor express trains stopped continued for quite some time.

Sanjo Station, even after its extension, continued to be a station at which express trains stopped after 1916, but such an arrangement changed during WWII and an era during which Gojo Station was the only stop between Shichijo Station and Sanjo Station, at which neither super express nor express train stops were made for quite some time.

Even after the extension of the line to Sanjo Station, Gojo Station continued to be a station at which express trains stopped after 1916, such an arrangement changed during WWII and there was an era during which Gojo Station was the only stop between Shichijo Station and Sanjo Station, in which neither super express nor express train stops were made for quite some time.
sen.cmt: 「路線が三条まで延びたあとも」と解釈しました。

sen.j: これは、四条・七条と違って京都市電が交差していなかったことが要因とみられる。
sen.e: It is considered that, unlike Shijo and Shichijo, the situation was caused by Kyoto City trams not crossing.
sen.cmt: 市電が交差する相手方不詳。
sen.e: It is considered that, unlike Shijo and Shichijo, the situation was due to the fact that Kyoto City trams did not cross.
It is considered that, unlike Shijo and Shichijo, the situation was due to the fact that Kyoto City Trams did not cross.

sen.j: また太平洋戦争末期(1945年7月)に五条通り南側の強制疎開が行われ、その後も更地のままで有ったが昭和30年頃に五条通りを拡幅する事となり、駅をそれまでの五条通りの南側から北側に移設して、現在の五条大橋が建設された。
sen.e: Moreover, forced demolition which took place south of Gojo-dori Street towards the end of WWII (July 1945) created lots remaining empty thereafter, but as a plan to widen Gojo-dori Street came up around 1955, the station was relocated from south of Gojo-dori Street to the north of it and the present Gojo Ohashi Bridge constructed.
sen.cmt: 文脈に疑問を感じます。
sen.e: Moreover, the forced demolition south of Gojo-dori Street, which took place toward the end of WWII (July 1945), created lots of empty space, but as a plan to widen Gojo-dori Street came up in or around 1955 the station was relocated from south of Gojo-dori Street to the north of it and the present Gojo Ohashi Bridge was constructed.

Moreover, the forced demolition south of Gojo-dori Street, which took place toward the end of WWII (July 1945), created lots of empty space, but as a plan to widen Gojo-dori Street came up in or around 1955 the station was relocated from south of Gojo-dori Street to the north of it and the present Gojo Ohashi Bridge was constructed.

sen.j: その後、昭和40年代に大谷本廟の南側から山科を経由して逢坂山の手前で三条通りへと繋がる「東山バイパス」が造られ国道1号線が京津線の走る三条通りから五条通りに代わり、朝夕のラッシュ時の五条踏み切りで慢性的に大渋滞が発生。
sen.e: Thereafter, the 「Higashiyama Bypass」 linking south of Otani Mausoleum to Sanjo-dori Street just before Osakayama via Yamashina was constructed and, instead of National Highway No.1 between Sanjo-dori Street to Gojo-dori Street on which the Keishin Line runs, severe chronic congestions occur at the Gojo grade crossing during morning and evening rush hours.
sen.cmt: 東山バイパスの完成時期が調べにもかかわらず不詳につき、“昭和40年代”は不記述。
sen.e: Thereafter, the "Higashiyama Bypass" linking the south of Otani Mausoleum to Sanjo-dori Street just before Osakayama via Yamashina was constructed and, instead of National Highway No. 1 between Sanjo-dori Street to Gojo-dori Street on which the Keishin Line runs, severe chronic congestion began to occur at the Gojo Grade crossing during the morning and evening rush hours.

Thereafter, the 'Higashiyama Bypass' linking the south of Otani Mausoleum to Sanjo-dori Street just before Osakayama via Yamashina was constructed, and the National Route 1 was changed from Sanjo-dori Street where Keishin Line ran to Gojo-dori Street; this caused severe chronic congestion to occur at the Gojo Grade crossing during the morning and evening rush hours.
sen.cmt: National Routeとしました。国道が三条通りから五条通りに変わった、と訳しました。

sen.j: 昭和47年京阪線の立体交差化事業が都市計画決定を受け、昭和54年地下化工事開始。
sen.e: Incidental to executing city planning for grade separation involving Keihan Line in 1972, works for it going underground commenced in 1979.
Incidental to the execution of city planning for grade separation involving the Keihan Line in 1972, the work of taking it underground commenced in 1979.
Incidental to the execution of city planning for grade separation involving the Keihan Line in 1972, the work of taking it underground commenced in 1979.

sen.j: 昭和62年5月に地下化、翌63年5月に地上廃線跡に都市計画道路「川端通り」が完成し、地下化工事が完了した。
sen.e: Became an underground station in May 1987 and city planning road 「Kawabata-dori Street」 constructed on land where surface tracks once existed opened to traffic in May 1988 completing the going-underground project.

It became an underground station in May 1987 and the city planning road (Kawabata-dori Street), constructed on land where surface tracks once existed, opened to traffic in May 1988, thereby completing the underground project.

It became an underground station in May 1987 and the city planning road 'Kawabata-dori Street,' constructed on land where surface tracks once existed, opened to traffic in May 1988, thereby completing the underground project.

sen.j: 1910年（明治43年）4月15日 京阪本線の京都側の終着駅として開業。
sen.e: Inaugurated as Keihan Main Line's Kyoto terminal on April 15, 1910.
It was inaugurated as Keihan Main Line's Kyoto terminal on April 15, 1910.
April 15, 1910: The station was inaugurated as Keihan Main Line's Kyoto terminal.

sen.j: 1916年（大正5年）4月1日 急行停車駅となる。
sen.e: Becomes a station at which express trains stop on April 1, 1916.
On April 1, 1916 it became a station at which express trains could stop.
April 1, 1916: The station became a station at which express trains could stop.

sen.j: 1935年（昭和10年）6月29日 鴨川大水害・五条大橋の倒壊、三条行きホームの破損
sen.e: Massive flooding of Kamogawa River, collapse of Gojo Ohashi Bridge and damage to Sanjo bound platform occurred on June 29, 1935.
Massive flooding of the Kamogawa River, the collapse of Gojo Ohashi Bridge and damage to the Sanjo-bound platform occurred on June 29, 1935.
June 29, 1935: Massive flooding of the Kamo-gawa River, the collapse of Gojo Ohashi Bridge and damage to the Sanjo-bound platform occurred.

sen.j: 1943年（昭和18年）10月1日 会社合併により京阪神急行電鉄の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a station Keihanshin Express Railway station on Oct.1, 1943 from corporate merger.
It became a station for the Keihanshin Express Railway on October 1, 1943, as the result of the corporate merger.
October 1, 1943: The station became a station for the Keihanshin-Kyuko-Dentetsu, as a result of the corporate merger.
sen.cmt: Keihanshin-Kyuko-Dentetsuで統一しました。年表表記に統一

sen.j: 1944年（昭和19年）2月5日 急行停車を廃止。
sen.e: Became a non-stop station for express trains from Feb. 5, 1944.
It became a non-stop station for express trains on February 5, 1944.
February 5, 1944: The station became a non-stop station for express trains.

sen.j: 1945年（昭和20年）9月15日 駅休止
sen.e: Station suspended operations on Sept. 15, 1945.
The station operations were suspended on September 15, 1945.
September 15, 1945: The station operations were suspended.

sen.j: 1946年（昭和21年）5月3日 駅の営業再開
sen.e: Station reopened for business on May 13, 1946.
The station reopened for business on May 13, 1946.
May 13, 1946: The station reopened for business.

sen.j: 1949年（昭和24年）12月1日 会社分離により京阪電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a Ｋｅｉｈａｎ Electric Railway station on Dec.1, 1949 from corporate spin-off.
It became a Keihan Electric Railway station on December 1, 1949, due to the corporate spin-off.
December 1, 1949: The station became a Keihan Electric Railway station due to the corporate spin-off.

sen.j: 1957年（昭和32年) 1月 五条大橋の架け替え(拡幅)工事に伴い、三条行きホームが五条通南側から北側へ移設。
sen.e: Ｓａｎｊｏ bound platform relocated from southern to northern side of Gojo-dori Street in January 1957 due to works to reconstruct (widen) Gojo Ohashi Bridge.
The Sanjo-bound platform was relocated from the southern side to the northern side of Gojo-dori Street in January 1957 due to the project of reconstructing (widening) Gojo Ohashi Bridge.
January 1957: The Sanjo-bound platform was relocated from the southern side to the northern side of Gojo-dori Street due to the project of reconstructing (widening) Gojo Ohashi Bridge.

sen.j: 1979年（昭和54年）3月20日 地下化工事着手。
sen.e: Works for going underground initiated on March 20, 1979.
The work of going underground commenced on March 20, 1979.
March 20, 1979: The work of going underground commenced.

sen.j: 1982年（昭和57年）10月23日 地下化工事に伴い淀屋橋行きホームを五条通り北側から南側へ移設。
sen.e: Yodoyabashi bound platform relocated from northern to southern side of Gojo-dori Street on Oct.23, 1982 incidental to commencement of underground construction works.
The Yodoyabashi-bound platform was relocated from the northern side to the southern side of Gojo-dori Street on October 23, 1982, incidental with the commencement of underground construction work.
October 23, 1982: The Yodoyabashi-bound platform was relocated from the northern side to the southern side of Gojo-dori Street, incidental with the commencement of underground construction work.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）5月24日 地下駅化。
sen.e: Completed as an underground station on May 24, 1987.
It was completed as an underground station on May 24, 1987.
May 24, 1987: The station was completed as an underground station.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）7月15日 浸水事故、線路からホームの高さまで浸水。
sen.e: Inundated up to platform level due to flooding on July 15, 1987.
The facility was inundated up to platform level due to flooding on July 15, 1987.
July 15, 1987: The facility was inundated up to platform level due to flooding.

sen.j: 終日運休、翌日始発より運転再開。
sen.e: Operations suspended all day but recommenced from the first train on the following day.
Operations were suspended all day but commenced again with the first train of the following day.
Operations were suspended all day but commenced again with the first train of the following day.

sen.j: 1988年（昭和63年）5月10日 京阪線の地下化工事竣工・川端通り開通。
sen.e: Works to convert Keihan Line into a subway system completed on May 10, 1988 and Kawabata-dori Street above opened to traffic.
The work of converting the Keihan Line to a subway system was completed on May 10, 1988, and Kawabata-dori Street above opened to traffic.
May 10, 1988: The work of converting the Keihan Line to a subway system was completed, and Kawabata-dori Street above opened to traffic.

sen.j: 1988年（昭和63年）9月1日 駅構内「終日禁煙」を実施。
sen.e: 「No smoking (throughtout the day)」 within station premises put into effect on Sept.1, 1988.
sen.cmt: 英文に”終日”明記の必要性は？
sen.e: The rule, "No smoking (throughout the day)" went into effect within station premises on September 1, 1988.
September 1, 1988: The 'no smoking throughout the day' rule went into effect within station premises.

sen.j: 1989年（平成元年）9月27日 京阪鴨東線運行準備のダイヤ改正で45年ぶりに急行停車駅となる。
sen.e: Became a station at which express trains commenced stopping once again after an interval of 45 years since Sept. 27, 1989 pursuant to a revised timetable prepared for operating the Keihan Oto Line.
It became a station at which express trains would stop again after an interval of 45 years on Sept. 27, 1989, pursuant to a revised timetable prepared for operation of the Keihan Oto Line.
September 27, 1989: The station became a station at which express trains would stop again after an interval of 45 years, pursuant to a revised timetable prepared for operation of the Keihan Oto Line.

sen.j: 2008年（平成20年）10月19日 五条駅から清水五条駅に改称予定。
sen.e: Gojo Station is scheduled to be renamed Kiyomizu Gojo Station from Oct.19, 2008.
Gojo Station was scheduled to be renamed Kiyomizu Gojo Station effective on October 19, 2008.
October 19, 2008: Gojo Station was scheduled to be renamed Kiyomizu Gojo Station effective.
sen.cmt: Kiyomizu-Gojoとしました。年表表記に統一

sen.j: 京阪電気鉄道
sen.e: Keihan Electric Railway
Keihan Electric Railway
Keihan Electric Railway

sen.j: 京阪本線
sen.e: Keihan Main Line
Keihan Main Line
Keihan Main Line

■K-Ltd. express train・■Super express train

sen.cmt: 頭文字を大文字に・を/に変更しました。■を削除しました。

sen.j: 通過
sen.e: Non-stop
Non-stop
Non-stop

sen.j: ■急行・■準急・■普通
sen.e: ■Express train ■Local express train ■Local train
■Express train ■Local express train ■Local train
Express/Local Express/Local
sen.cmt: 頭文字を大文字に 普通→Local・を/に変更しました。■を削除しました。

sen.j: 七条駅 - 五条駅 - 四条駅_(京阪)
sen.e: Shichijo Station - Gojo Station - Shijo Station (Keihan)
Shichijo Station - Gojo Station - Shijo Station (Keihan)
Shichijo Station - Gojo Station - Shijo Station (Keihan)

sen.j: ※日中は普通のみ毎時6本停車。
sen.e: ※Only six local trains stop every hour during daytime.
※During the daytime there are only six hourly local train stops.
※During the daytime only six local trains make stops each hour.
